title: Peter Loli
text:
Peter Loli (born 2 February 1980) is an <a href="Australian%20people">Australian</a> <a href="Rugby%20Union">rugby union</a> player who played as an outside back for the Queensland Reds as well as for Queensland Reds B (also known as the Queensland Red Heelers).
Career.
Born in <a href="Auckland">Auckland</a>, New Zealand, Loli began playing his junior rugby for <a href="Otahuhu%20RFC">Otahuhu RFC</a> before moving to Queensland at the age of 12. After arriving in Australia Loli played his junior rugby for <a href="North%20Brisbane%20Rugby%20Club">North Brisbane Rugby Club</a>.
While attending <a href="Marist%20College%20Ashgrove">Marist College Ashgrove</a>, Loli signed with the <a href="Queensland%20Reds">Queensland Reds</a>. Loli became the second player ever to sign with the Queensland Reds while still at school, the first being <a href="Elton%20Flatley">Elton Flatley</a>.
Loli also represented Australia in the <a href="World%20Rugby%20Sevens%20Series">World Rugby Sevens Series</a> (formerly known as the IRB Sevens World Series) as well as being selected for the <a href="Australian%20Barbarians">Australian Barbarians</a>. 
Loli played premier grade for <a href="Brothers%20Old%20Boys">Brothers Old Boys</a>, <a href="North%20Brisbane%20Rugby%20Club">North Brisbane Rugby Club</a>, and finally with <a href="GPS%20Rugby%20Club">GPS Rugby Club</a>.
Personal life.
Peter Loli is the son of Laufika Loli and Alosina To'omalatai, both of Samoan heritage. Loli's mother is the cousin of Samoan rugby international <a href="Stan%20To%27omalatai">Stan To'omalatai</a>.
